actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on July 9, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of a Cleveland Police Office who died in the line of duty.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 333
actions-list.actionItem: 51 (Roll no. 337).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5441 — "To reauthorize Long Island Sound programs, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the administration of the Oath of Office to the gentleman from Colorado, Mr. Lopez, the whole number of the House is 433.

Representative-Elect Greg Lopez, Fourth District, State of Colorado, presented himself in the well of the House for the purpose of taking the Oath of Office which was administered by the Speaker of the House.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. The Acting Clerk transmitted to the House a copy of a letter received from Ms. Jena M. Griswold, Colorado Secretary of State, indicating that, according to the unofficial results for the Special Election held on June 25, 2024, the Honorable Greg Lopez was elected for Representative to Congress for the Fourth Congressional District of Colorado.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 349
actions-list.actionItem: 19 (Roll no. 336).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 897 — "To provide for the establishment of the Alabama Underwater Forest National Marine Sanctuary, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5443.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5443 — "To establish a policy regarding appraisal and valuation services for real property for a transaction over which the Secretary of the Interior has jurisdiction, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6062.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6062 — "To restore the ability of the people of American Samoa to approve amendments to the territorial constitution based on majority rule in a democratic act of self-determination, as authorized pursuant to an Act of Congress delegating administration of Federal territorial law in the territory to the President, and to the Secretary of the Interior under Executive Order 10264, dated June 29, 1951, under which the Constitution of American Samoa was approved and may be amended without requirement for further congressional action, subject to the authority of Congress under the Territorial Clause in article IV, section 3, clause 2 of the United States Constitution."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5770.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5770 — "To reauthorize certain United States Geological Survey water data enhancement programs."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5441.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5441 — "To reauthorize Long Island Sound programs, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 897.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 897 — "To provide for the establishment of the Alabama Underwater Forest National Marine Sanctuary, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jerry L. Carl to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
